title: Health & Wellbeing
description: Learn vocabulary for discussing physical health, mental wellness, and lifestyle choices.

words.meaning: the state of being comfortable, healthy, and happy
words.example: Regular exercise contributes to overall wellbeing.

words.meaning: a physical or mental sign of illness
words.example: Fatigue is a common symptom of stress.

words.meaning: identification of an illness through examination
words.example: The diagnosis came after several tests.

words.meaning: action taken to stop something from happening
words.example: Prevention is better than cure.

words.meaning: treatment for physical or mental illness
words.example: Physical therapy helped her recover from the injury.

words.meaning: a drug or medicine used to treat illness
words.example: The doctor prescribed medication for his condition.

words.meaning: the process of providing food for health and growth
words.example: Good nutrition is essential for children's development.

words.meaning: resistance to infection or disease
words.example: Vaccines help build immunity against diseases.

words.meaning: lasting for a long time, especially of illness
words.example: Chronic stress can lead to serious health problems.

words.meaning: characterized by much sitting and little physical activity
words.example: A sedentary lifestyle increases health risks.

words.meaning: producing good effects
words.example: Walking is beneficial for both physical and mental health.

words.meaning: average in amount or intensity
words.example: Moderate exercise is recommended for beginners.

words.meaning: treating the whole person, not just symptoms
words.example: The clinic offers a holistic approach to healthcare.

words.meaning: able to recover quickly from difficulties
words.example: Emotionally resilient people cope better with stress.

words.meaning: awareness of the present moment
words.example: Practicing mindfulness can reduce anxiety.

words.meaning: to identify an illness through examination
words.example: The doctor diagnosed her with a vitamin deficiency.

words.meaning: to recommend a treatment or medicine
words.example: The physician prescribed rest and plenty of fluids.

words.meaning: to return to normal health after illness
words.example: It took months to fully recover from the surgery.

words.meaning: to keep in good condition
words.example: Regular check-ups help maintain good health.

words.meaning: to make pain or suffering less severe
words.example: Stretching can alleviate muscle tension.

words.meaning: exhaustion caused by prolonged stress
words.example: Many employees experience burnout from overwork.

words.meaning: feeling of worry or nervousness
words.example: Anxiety can affect both mental and physical health.

words.meaning: condition of being very overweight
words.example: Obesity increases the risk of heart disease.

words.meaning: inability to sleep
words.example: Stress often leads to insomnia.

words.meaning: chemical processes in the body that maintain life
words.example: Exercise helps boost metabolism.

words.meaning: additional nutrient taken to improve diet
words.example: Many people take vitamin supplements.

words.meaning: process of restoring health after illness or injury
words.example: Rehabilitation after surgery takes several weeks.

words.meaning: spread from one person to another
words.example: The flu is highly contagious.

words.meaning: causing harm or damage
words.example: Smoking is detrimental to your health.

words.meaning: likely to be affected by something
words.example: Elderly people are more susceptible to infections.

words.meaning: a minor illness or health problem
words.example: Common ailments include headaches and colds.

words.meaning: a treatment or medicine that cures or relieves
words.example: Herbal remedies are popular for minor health issues.

words.meaning: state of being strong, active, and energetic
words.example: A healthy diet contributes to your vitality.

words.meaning: extreme tiredness resulting from physical or mental exertion
words.example: Chronic fatigue can be a sign of underlying health issues.

words.meaning: conditions or practices conducive to maintaining health
words.example: Good hygiene prevents the spread of diseases.

words.meaning: ability to sustain prolonged physical or mental effort
words.example: Regular training builds stamina and endurance.

words.meaning: to provide with food or other substances for growth and health
words.example: Fresh fruits and vegetables nourish the body.

words.meaning: to become progressively worse
words.example: Without treatment, his condition began to deteriorate.

words.meaning: widespread occurrence of an infectious disease in a community
words.example: The flu epidemic affected thousands of people.

words.meaning: isolation to prevent the spread of disease
words.example: Travelers were placed in quarantine for two weeks.

words.meaning: process of making someone immune to infection
words.example: Childhood immunization protects against many diseases.

words.meaning: a prescribed course of treatment or diet
words.example: She follows a strict exercise regimen.

words.meaning: position in which someone holds their body
words.example: Good posture is important for back health.

words.meaning: relating to the heart and blood vessels
words.example: Running is excellent cardiovascular exercise.

words.meaning: relating to breathing or the organs used for breathing
words.example: Asthma is a respiratory condition.

words.meaning: relating to the healing of disease
words.example: Massage has therapeutic benefits for muscle pain.

words.meaning: preventing success or development; harmful
words.example: Some medications have adverse side effects.

words.meaning: best or most favorable
words.example: Eight hours of sleep is optimal for most adults.

words.meaning: to make someone feel or look young again
words.example: A vacation can help rejuvenate your mind and body.

words.meaning: to take action to reduce or prevent something bad
words.example: Exercise helps combat stress and depression.

exercises.answer: A sedentary lifestyle increases health risks.

exercises.answer: Walking is beneficial for both physical and mental health.

exercises.answer: Moderate exercise is recommended for beginners.

exercises.answer: The clinic offers a holistic approach to healthcare.

exercises.answer: Emotionally resilient people cope better with stress.

exercises.answer: Obesity increases the risk of heart disease.

많은 사람들이 비타민 보충제를 복용합니다.

exercises.answer: Smoking is detrimental to your health.

exercises.question: Good hygiene prevents the spread of diseases.
Regular training builds stamina and endurance.
Fresh fruits and vegetables nourish the body.
exercises.answer: 신선한 과일과 채소는 몸에 영양을 공급합니다.

exercises.question: Without treatment, his condition began to deteriorate.
exercises.answer: 치료 없이는 그의 상태가 악화되기 시작했습니다.

exercises.question: The flu epidemic affected thousands of people.
exercises.answer: 독감 유행은 수천 명의 사람들에게 영향을 미쳤습니다.

exercises.question: Travelers were placed in quarantine for two weeks.
Childhood immunization protects against many diseases.
exercises.answer: 어린 시절 예방접종은 많은 질병으로부터 보호합니다.

exercises.question: Exercise helps combat stress and depression.
exercises.answer: 운동은 스트레스와 우울증에 대항하는 데 도움이 됩니다.

Regular check-ups help maintain good health.
exercises.answer: 정기 검진은 좋은 건강을 유지하는 데 도움이 됩니다.

exercises.question: A holistic approach treats the whole person.
exercises.answer: 전인적 접근 방식은 전체 사람을 치료합니다.

exercises.question: Emotionally resilient people adapt to challenges quickly.
exercises.answer: 감정적으로 회복력 있는 사람들은 도전에 빠르게 적응합니다.
